intro: Camptolepis, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Camptolepis species are often used in native plant gardens due to their ornamental value and ecological benefits.
